1.q_string: The indication of the state of charge of a battery is best given by:

q_option: An increase in area of the plates inside the electrolyte
An increase in distance between the two electrodes
An increase of age of the battery
1.q_string: Internal resistance of a battery cell decreases with:

q_option: Silver and gold in equal mass proportion
Silver and gold in proportion to their atomic weights

\(Cu ( s )\left| Cu ^{2+}\left( C _{1} M \right) \| Cu ^{2+}\left( C _{2} M \right)\right| Cu ( s )\)

1.q_string:
Assertion: Conductivity decreases with the decrease in concentration both the weak and strong electrolytes.

Reason: Number of ions per unit volume linearly decreases in both electrolytes.

Standard electrode potentials of \(\mathrm{Fe}^{2+}+2 \mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{Fe}\) and \(\mathrm{Fe}^{3+}+3 \mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{F}\) e are \(-0.440 \mathrm{~V}\) and \(-0.036 \mathrm{~V}\) respectively. The standard electrode potential \(\left(E^{\circ}\right.\) ) for \(\mathrm{Fe}^{3+}+\mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{Fe}^{2+}\) is:

\(2 H _{2} O \rightarrow 2 H _{2}+ O _{2}\)

(ii) Neutralization

(iii) Decomposition

provides an easy handle to carry the cell

(A) 1 faraday \(=96,500\) coulomb.
It is a charge of 1 mole electrons.

What will be \(\Delta H\) for the reaction; \(Ag ( s )+\frac{1}{2} Hg _{2} Cl _{2}( s ) \rightarrow AgCl ( s )+ Hg ( l )\) at \(25^{\circ} c\), if this reaction can be conducted in a cell for which the emf \(=0.0455\) volt at this temperature with temperature coefficient \(3.389 \times 10^{-4} volt deg ^{-1}\) ?

Consider the following half-cell reactions and associated standard half-cell potentials and determine the maximum voltage that can be obtained by combination resulting in spontaneous processes:
$$
\begin{array}{l}
AuBr _{4}^{-}( aq )+3 e ^{-} \rightarrow Au ( s )+4 Br ^{-}( aq ) ; E ^{\circ}=-0.86 V \\
Eu ^{3+}( aq )+ e ^{-} \rightarrow Eu ^{2+}( aq ) ; E ^{\circ}=-0.43 V \\
Sn ^{2+}( aq )+2 e ^{-} \rightarrow Sn ( s ) ; E ^{\circ}=-0.14 V \\
IO ^{-}( aq )+ H _{2} O ( l )+2 e ^{-} \rightarrow I ^{-}(\text {aq })+2 OH ^{-}(\text {aq }) ; E ^{\circ}=+0.49 V
\end{array}
$$

q_option: Electrode of half-cell potential \(-0.44 V\) will act as anode
Electrode of half-cell potential \(-0.44 V\) will act as cathode
Electrode of half-cell potential \(0.799 V\) will act as anode
Electrode of half-cell potential \(-0.44 V\) will act as a positive terminal

q_option: the reaction occurs only once and after use it can be recharged  and reused again
electrode reactions can be reversed by an external energy source and can be used again and again
the reaction is reversed periodically and after use over a period of time and so can be reused again
the reaction occurs only once and after use over a period of time battery becomes dead and cannot be reused again
1.q_string: In the primary batteries ___________________.

The below reaction is the gold-plating process reaction.

\(\mathrm{Au}^{3+}(\mathrm{aq})+3 \mathrm{e}^{-} \rightarrow \mathrm{Au}(\mathrm{s})\)

If \(0.600 \mathrm{~g}\) of \(\mathrm{Au}\) is plated onto a metal, how many coulombs are used?
